column1: As we continue to combat the coronavirus we must not forget we are approaching a difficult flu season as well. If you can please consider getting your flu shot as soon as possible to keep one another healthy! Details on how you can get vaccinated: https://t.co/xtT9ejXGVF

We're seeing the number of COVID cases increase & it's important to remember simple steps we can take to stay healthy: Wash your hands avoid touching your face stay home if you are sick & get tested & please wear a mask. We'll get through this but only if we do it together.

From leadership on national security to championing #CTE & his work to secure #COVID19 relief - Rep. Langevin is working to make a difference in the lives of RIers. He will never take your support for granted! https://t.co/dhyYYlfHnS

Rep. Langevin spoke to @WPRI12's @StephMachado about his reelection & emphasized proven leadership with experience matters. The Congressman also spoke of the need for additional #COVID19 relief the importance of affordable healthcare & other priorities. https://t.co/mzZ3MJp0S5

“As states continue to face steep fiscal challenges due to the COVID-19 pandemic we must keep transportation projects moving forward to support good-paying jobs for local workers and build the foundation for Rhode Island’s future" said Rep. Langevin https://t.co/RQc1CzCN9n

The COVID-19 pandemic and our increased reliance on the internet to accomplish everyday tasks has made it abundantly clear that we should build out our digital identity infrastructure said Rep. Langevin.  https://t.co/QIkTGqF0qa

REMINDER: Today is Primary Election Day! Due to the coronavirus your polling location may have changed. If you aren't sure where your voting location is you can visit:  https://t.co/7wHFnZa51X   Polls are open until 8pm. Be sure to cast your vote for Congressman Langevin! https://t.co/DVsnFMU3Oa
Primary Election day is now 24 hours away! Due to the coronavirus polling locations have changed. To find your new polling place please visit https://t.co/7wHFnZrFTv

Senate Republicans need to come to the table & negotiate another coronavirus relief bill or take up the #HeroesAct passed by the House 3+ months ago. The American people don't have the luxury to wait for the help they are in desperate need of.  https://t.co/JbumJSYWiV

Rep. Langevin joined @GeneValicenti  on @wpro and discussed his expertise in cybersecurity the upcoming election and the most recent national efforts to help combat the coronavirus.  https://t.co/euxzOHY9j1

This pandemic will not "disappear." We need to listen to our public health experts and follow proper health guidelines like face coverings and social distancing. Let's do everything we can to prevent the spread of the coronavirus https://t.co/JW800pPYmv

We will continue to work to provide even more assistance as we negotiate a fifth COVID aid bill. These federal funds will help hospitals continue their invaluable work against COVID-19. Said Rep. Langevin as he announced 73 Million in aid to RI hospitals https://t.co/fs6lsl2cRt

We're seeing spikes of #coronavirus across the country making it more important than ever to adhere to proper health guidelines to prevent further spread. We need to work side by side with our health professionals to protect public health.  https://t.co/tejJh18mh7
While we still recover from the devastating effects of the coronavirus it is crucial we continue to advocate for affordable health care and expand on the #ACA .   https://t.co/bK4Oc4CwLt

It is reckless to withdraw from the World Health Organization while we are in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic. This is a time we should be coming together to find solutions rather than severing our ties with critical international efforts. https://t.co/Z0GdHjI6h1

As we begin phase three of reopening our state and our economy it's important we still take precautions -- like wearing a face mask to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Together we can continue to slow the spread of coronavirus. https://t.co/xCTw0wnngi

Rep. Langevin pushes back on the Administration's decision to cut the budget of the Biological Threat Reduction Program.  This program helps detect and prevent future biological threats such as what we are facing now with the coronavirus.  https://t.co/eBtX38ej5F

Rep. Langevin is leading a bipartisan push that urges the inclusion of financial support to help local governments modernize Information Technology infrastructure in future coronavirus relief with security and efficiency in mind.  https://t.co/1uZZRNtRx7

As Rhode Island enters Phase 2 of re-opening it is imperative that we continue to follow safety guidelines like wearing your face masks & frequently wash your hands in order to prevent further spread of COVID-19. #MASKUP https://t.co/cQvaQJc5cr

Rep. Langevin proudly voted in favor of the Heroes Act the House's latest coronavirus relief bill. The bill would provide another round of stimulus checks hazard pay for frontline workers and help with testing and treatment. https://t.co/NHtk0QcOFn
Tune in to @wpri12 this evening at 7pm for a live Town Hall on the coronavirus with Rhode Island's Congressional Delegation. https://t.co/mTXE5q7FLt

Rep. Langevin weighs in on how the COVID-19 pandemic has magnified the need for a stronger cyber ecosystem to help government and businesses continuing to work during challenging times.   https://t.co/7TlqmIoZXK

Rep. Langevin went on the air with @wpro's @GeneValicenti to talk about the latest federal relief package to help RIers and combat the economic & public health impacts of the coronavirus pandemic.  https://t.co/B742W6Ragf
Langevin spoke to @washingtonpost  about the need for an alternate system to legislate in case of emergencies like the coronavirus outbreak.   https://t.co/bVIxaUlQev
Rep. Langevin along with RI's federal delegation announced $941000 in funding to support emergency workers on the frontlines of the COVID19 battle.  https://t.co/ZMXHavvnQD
Rep. Langevin co-sponsored legislation prioritizing $1 billion in emergency funds to support career and technical education programs disrupted by COVID-19.  https://t.co/jOQl4Rp8dE

Monday evening Congressman Langevin held another telephone town hall to answer questions from Rhode Islanders about recent relief legislation passed by Congress and resources available for those who have been impacted by the COVID-19 crisis.   https://t.co/uSRPbtwA9Y

Rep. Langevin led a letter to the Attorney General and the Secretary of Health and Human Services to prevent discrimination by ensuring patients aren’t denied care on the basis of a disability as health providers cope with the COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/s0jgYYh0fM
Representative Langevin has worked with his RI Congressional colleagues to secure more than 1.25 billion in support of Rhode Island's fight against the coronavirus. https://t.co/7cJKz2ZqVQ

Democrats and Republicans must come together to do what is right for our country. - Rep. Langevin. Learn more about the Congressman's Telephone Town Hall on the coronavirus situation: https://t.co/xEIW55k71T

Representative Langevin speaks about how legislation he introduced last year will help get needed medical equipment to frontline workers. "We have a duty to keep to keep the nurses doctors and first responders who are confronting COVID-19 safe..." https://t.co/msKQEcEKAh

Coronavirus preparedness & response efforts require coordination & communication across all levels of government & throughout communities. In addition it is recommended that citizens take proper measures as they would to avoid any illness. More info https://t.co/mw04ZMfOqe
